Burma: Fall of First Toungoo Empire after Pegu sacked by the Arakanese and Toungoo (city) forces. Siam captures the entire Tenasserim coast to Martaban. Arakanese capture delta ports; appoint Portuguese mercenary de Brito governor of Syriam
Siamese invasions take Martaban (1600) and Lan Na (1602) (to 1605)
Cambodia: The Spanish in Cambodia were massacred by Malay warlords.
Chile: The Real Situado, an annual payment from Potosí to Chile, is established.
Indinesia: The van Neck expedition returns to Europe. The expedition makes a 400 per cent profit. (to 1600)
Leaving Europe the previous year, a fleet of eight ships under Jacob van Neck was the first Dutch fleet to reach the ‘Spice Islands’ of Maluku.
Sweden: The War against Sigismund ends, resulting in the deposition of King Sigismund. The Kalmar Bloodbath (1599) and Åbo Bloodbath occurs on the followers on Sigismund.
